body_text.text: Indeed, mDia3C (hDia2C) has been reported to be a specific effector of RhoD (Gasman et al., 2003).

body_text.text: Activated RhoD binds to mDia3C and associates with early endosomes in the cell body.

body_text.text: They induce an alignment of early endosomes along actin filaments and markedly reduce the endosome motility by depending on Src tyrosine kinase activity.
body_text.section: cDNA cloning and plasmid construction

body_text.text: Thus RhoD is likely to utilize mDia3C for both the protrusion formation and the regulation of endosome movement through actin filaments.

body_text.text: mDia3 is also localized to the kinetochores and involved in kinetochore-microtubule attachment required for correct chromosome alignment and segregation, which is regulated by Cdc42 or Aurora B (Yasuda et al., 2004;Cheng et al., 2011).

body_text.section: cDNA cloning and plasmid construction

body_text.text: These results may indicate that actin nucleation/ elongation function of mDia3C, which is activated by RhoD, is essential for the protrusion formation.
body_text.section: cDNA cloning and plasmid construction

body_text.text: However, the protrusions formed by mDia3C(ΔDAD) were thicker and contained actin filament bundles thicker than those in the RhoD(G26V)-induced protrusions.
body_text.section: cDNA cloning and plasmid construction

body_text.text: Accordingly, although mDia3C is responsible for the thin actin filament bundle formation in the RhoD-induced protrusions, regulated activation of mDia3C mediated by RhoD may be required for the thin and long protrusion formation.
body_text.section: cDNA cloning and plasmid construction

body_text.text: Alternatively, cooperation between mDia3C and other effector proteins of RhoD might be necessary for the thin and long protrusion formation.
